message: Convore might be the best known at the moment but which other better known startups use Django?

I learned Django this weekend and I have to say - I was VERY impressed with how easy everything was to pick up and launch. Granted my tutorial app (a twitter clone) was FAR from pretty, it clearly was functional and showed off some of django's strong points.
Disqus (http://pycon.blip.tv/file/4880330/)
FWIW, a lot of us have moved on to Flask
Django is still a... fuller-stack offering than Flask though
@KrakensDen - And sometimes that's a huge plus.
StyleSeat is Django and Yelp is Python
I do appreciate Django's admin interface for updating entities and deleting an entities with all it's relations. Flask doesn't have something like this afaik.
Looks like I need to take a look at Django. Any good tutorials?
@dorkitude that raises the question: what SV/SF startups/projects are known to be using Flask?
@michaelkohler the official tutorial is a good place to start
Lissn uses Django, although we are in Silicon Beach, not SV :)  http://lissn.com
@myke Where is Silicon Beach? Never heard that term before.

@KrakensDen Yeah, I've been experimenting in a couple of projects using Pyramid and Flask and still get the feeling that for building a large site I would still use Django. Developing in Django may not be as fast as in Flask or as customizable as Pyramid (sometimes it can even get too custom) but its ORM is probably one of the best I've worked with,
and its abstractions are dead simple to get used to. (Unlike transversals and views in Pyramid that you need to read three times in order to understand how they work).
Yeah, there's also a lot of value in generic views, the forms module, the built-in authentication, and the documentation

@dabent I can find via Google references to any of the following areas as 'Silicon Beach': Sydney, Melbourne, Santa Barbara, San Diego, Miami, or Brooklyn. But I think Lissn is somewhere in southern California.
I love Flask and I'm beginning to get warmer towards Pyramid, but the wealth of django projects you can find is pretty incredible.

@gojomo I did a search... They were listed as being in Agoura Hills, CA, in the TechCrunch50, which is very close to Santa Monica. http://www.techcrunch50.com/2009/lissn/  Just up the road from Malibu! Hmmm. Wonder if they are hiring. :-)
@gojomo Yeah, I saw a few references as well and was hoping @myke could clarify. I kind of assumed Santa Monica, CA, (Google has a place there, among others) but I'm not sure.
@leah Thanks. It seems that the more well known Django companies are from NYC. It's hard to come by more cool companies from SF/SV (except Convore, Disqus)
We are using django at Readrboard! (NYC)
We use Django at Ion Torrent http://www.iontorrent.com/
